pattern.description:
Mode

pattern.example: The typical payment amount. Example when mode fails: mode of ISBN is not meaningful because people commonly the same book just once. Hence "the most common" value doesn't exist.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @baseId , @baseDate , @baseTarget , mode() WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY @column) AS "@columnName" FROM @propagatedTable GROUP BY @baseId, @baseDate, @baseTarget

SELECT @baseId , @baseDate , @baseTarget , ( SELECT TOP 1 @column FROM @propagatedTable t2 WHERE t.@baseId = t2.@baseId AND t.@baseDate = t2.@baseDate GROUP BY @column ORDER BY count(*) desc ) AS "@columnName" FROM @propagatedTable t GROUP BY @baseId, @baseDate, @baseTarget

SELECT @baseId , @baseDate , @baseTarget , @column AS "@columnName" FROM ( SELECT @baseId, @baseDate, @baseTarget, @column, count(*) AS count FROM @propagatedTable GROUP BY @baseId, @baseDate, @baseTarget, @column ) GROUP BY @baseId, @baseDate, @baseTarget HAVING count=max(count)
SELECT @baseId , @baseDate , @baseTarget , STATS_MODE(@column) AS "@columnName" FROM @propagatedTable GROUP BY @baseId, @baseDate, @baseTarget
